data.message:
I grew up in the same type of park.
I was considered the pathetic little white trailer trash girl that cared for her cracked out father, schizophrenic mother and siblings. 
It was never ending angony and yet still to this day, in a way, I miss those cold streets. 
And now, well now I'm the only one that truly made it out of that tailer park world. 
They hated me for how different I was. 
Now they love me for how different I still am.
